  • Method Details

    • testLambdaValueWithinValidRange

      @Test public void testLambdaValueWithinValidRange()
      This test checks if the ExponentialGenerator can be instantiated with a lambda value greater than 0 and with a very small positive value close to 0, without throwing any exceptions.

    • testLambdaValueOutsideValidRange

      @Test public void testLambdaValueOutsideValidRange()
      Test if ExponentialGenerator throws an exception when lambda is outside the valid range. Case a: Lambda value = 0 Case b: Lambda value invalid input: '<' 0 (negative)

    • testMinAndMaxOutsideValidRange

      @Test public void testMinAndMaxOutsideValidRange()
      Test if ExponentialGenerator throws an exception when min and max are outside the valid range.

    • testRandomNumberGenerationWithinRange

      @Test public void testRandomNumberGenerationWithinRange()
      Test if the random number generation is within the expected range and if it behaves consistently. For a given lambda and different min and max values, generate a large number of samples and check if the generated values are within the expected range, i.e., min invalid input: '<'= generated value invalid input: '<'= max.

    • testIncreasingLambdas

      @Test public void testIncreasingLambdas()
      Test generated values for different lambda values and if the distribution follows the expected behavior. Test generated values for different lambda values. Check if the distribution follows the expected behavior (higher lambda values result in smaller mean and variance)

    • testIncreasingRanges

      @Test public void testIncreasingRanges()
      Test generated values for different min and max values and if the distribution follows the expected behavior. Check if the distribution follows the expected behavior (higher min and max values result in larger mean and variance).

    • testLambdaExtremeCases

      @Test public void testLambdaExtremeCases()
      Test extreme cases for lambda value. Case a: Lambda value = Double.MAX_VALUE Case b: Lambda value = Double.MIN_VALUE Case c: Lambda value = Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY Case d: Lambda value = Double.NEGATIVE_INFINITY Case e: Lambda value = Double.NaN Case f: Lambda value = 0 Case g: Lambda value = -1 Case h: Lambda value = 1

    • testMinMaxExtremeCases

      @Test public void testMinMaxExtremeCases()
      Test extreme cases for min and max values, i.e. min = max, min > max, min = 0, max = 0, min = 1, max = 1, min = 0, max = -1, min = -1, max = 0. All cases should throw an IllegalArgumentException.

    • testSampleAverageAndVariance

      @Test public void testSampleAverageAndVariance()
      Test if the average and variance of samples generated from the distribution are within an acceptable error range.
